verses.roman:
te sampratīta-smṛtayaḥ
samutthāya jalāntikāt
āsan su-vismitāḥ sarve
vīkṣamāṇāḥ parasparam

synonyms: te—they; sampratīta—regaining perfectly; smṛtayaḥ—their memory; samutthāya—rising up; jala-antikāt—from out of the water; āsan—they became; su-vismitāḥ—very surprised; sarve—all; vīkṣamāṇāḥ—looking; parasparam—at one another.
translation: Regaining their full consciousness, the cows and boys stood up out of the water and began to look at one another in great astonishment.
